title: Offline-First Architecture
description: NasNetConnect operates in environments where network connectivity to the MikroTik router is inherently unstable — server rooms, mobile devices, and embedded containers. The offline-first system ensures the UI remains functional and consistent across degraded and fully disconnected states. It is composed of three cooperating modules: cache persistence (Apollo InMemoryCache → IndexedDB via localforage), offline detection (four signal sources converging to a Zustand network store), and an offline mutation queue (FIFO, deduplicated, auto-replaying queue backed by IndexedDB). Together they allow the app to serve cached data immediately on load, detect connectivity changes within seconds, and defer mutations until the connection is restored.
